summary: In 2019, about 39% of U.S. natural gas exports went through export facilities—in which the gas is liquefied and loaded onto ships for transport. Multiple federal agencies regulate export facility design. Federal guidance says that agencies should review regulations every 3-5 years and, if needed, adopt current technical standards for safety and environmental protection. But some regulations haven't been updated. For example, one agency requires...
title: Natural Gas Exports: Updated Guidance and Regulations Could Improve Facility Permitting Processes
